3 from niryo_robot_poses_handlers.file_manager import FileManager, NiryoRobotFileException
4 
5 import numpy as np
6 
7 
8 class Workspace(object):
9  """
10  Represents a workspace that is defined by 4 points that represent the
11  visual markers.
12 
13  :param name: unique (!) name that will be used to reference it
14  :type name: str
15  :param points: points defining the workspace, 0th element is the origin.
16  :type points: [float, float, float]
17  :param x_width: width of the workspace in m (between point_0 and point_1)
18  :type x_width: float
19  :param y_width: width of the workspace in m (between point_0 and point_3)
20  :type y_width: float
21  :param transform: tf transform msg from base_link to workspace origin
22  :type transform: geometry_msgs::TransformStamped
23  """
24 
25  def __init__(self, name, description):
26  self.name = name
27  self.description = description
28  self.robot_poses = []
29  self.points = []
30  self.x_width = 0.0
31  self.y_width = 0.0
32  self.yaw_center = "0"
33  self.position_matrix = np.array([])
34  self.rotation_matrix = np.array([])
35 
36  def to_dict(self):
37  dict_ = dict()
38  dict_["name"] = self.name
39  dict_["description"] = self.description
40  dict_["robot_poses"] = self.robot_poses
41  dict_["points"] = self.points
42  dict_["x_width"] = self.x_width
43  dict_["y_width"] = self.y_width
44  dict_["yaw_center"] = self.yaw_center
45  dict_["position_matrix"] = self.position_matrix.tolist()
46  dict_["rotation_matrix"] = self.rotation_matrix.tolist()
47  return dict_
48 
49  @classmethod
50  def from_dict(cls, dict_):
51  ws = cls(dict_["name"], dict_["description"])
52  ws.robot_poses = dict_["robot_poses"]
53  ws.points = dict_["points"]
54  ws.x_width = dict_["x_width"]
55  ws.y_width = dict_["y_width"]
56  ws.yaw_center = dict_["yaw_center"]
57  ws.position_matrix = np.array(dict_["position_matrix"])
58  ws.rotation_matrix = np.array(dict_["rotation_matrix"])
59  return ws
60 
61  def get_value(self):
62  return self.points, self.robot_poses
63 
64 
65 class WorkspaceManager(FileManager):
66  """
67  Manages the creation, storage and loading of worspaces.
68 
69  :raises NiryoRobotFileException:
70  """
71  object_type = Workspace
72 
73  def __init__(self, ws_dir):
74  FileManager.__init__(self, ws_dir, "workspace")
75 
76  @staticmethod
77  def __validate_points(points):
78  robot_points = np.array(points)
79  if robot_points.shape != (4, 3):
80  raise ValueError("Points must contain 4 points with 3 coordinates each.")
81 
82  x_1 = robot_points[1] - robot_points[0]
83  x_2 = robot_points[2] - robot_points[3]
84  y_1 = robot_points[3] - robot_points[0]
85  y_2 = robot_points[2] - robot_points[1]
86 
87  # Check that the workspace as a sane size
88  min_ws_size = 0.01 # 1cm
89  for vec in (x_1, x_2, y_1, y_2):
90  if np.linalg.norm(vec) < min_ws_size:
91  raise ValueError("Workspace points are too close. "
92  "Make sure that there are no duplicates in the workspace points")
93 
94  # Check that the workspace is approx. rectangular
95  allowed_error = 0.02 # 2cm
96  if np.linalg.norm(x_1 - x_2) > allowed_error or np.linalg.norm(y_1 - y_2) > allowed_error:
97  raise ValueError("Workspace points don't form a rectangle. "
98  "Check that the points are in the right order.")
99 
100  def create(self, workspace_name, points, robot_poses=None, description=""):
101  """
102  Create a new workspace based on 4 recorded points corresponding to the
103  real positions of the visual markers.
104 
105  :param workspace_name: unique (!) name that will be used to reference it
106  :param robot_poses: ?
107  :type workspace_name: str
108  :type description: str
109  :param points: real positions of the visual markers in robot coordinates
110  :type points: [float, float, float]
111  """
112  if self.exists(workspace_name):
113  raise NiryoRobotFileException("Workspace {} already exists".format(workspace_name))
114 
115  self.__validate_points(points)
116 
117  robot_points = np.array(points)
118  relative_points = np.array([[0, 0, 1], [1, 0, 1], [1, 1, 1], [0, 1, 1]], dtype=float)
119  position_matrix = np.linalg.lstsq(relative_points, robot_points, rcond=None)[0].T
120 
121  # Calculate coordinate system for rotation
122  ws_points = np.dot(position_matrix, relative_points.T).T
123  ws_x_vec = ws_points[1] - ws_points[0] # x vector is from point 0 to point 1
124  ws_y_vec = ws_points[3] - ws_points[0] # preliminary y vecor is from point 0 to point 3
125  # but not necessarily perpendicular to the x vector. We just need it to calculate the normal vector
126  ws_z_vec = np.cross(ws_x_vec, ws_y_vec) # The z vector is the normal vector to our workspace plane
127  ws_y_vec = np.cross(ws_z_vec, ws_x_vec) # Recalculate the y vector s.th. it is perpendicular to x and y
128 
129  # Normalize
130  ws_x_vec = ws_x_vec / np.linalg.norm(ws_x_vec)
131  ws_y_vec = ws_y_vec / np.linalg.norm(ws_y_vec)
132  ws_z_vec = ws_z_vec / np.linalg.norm(ws_z_vec)
133 
134  workspace_rotation = np.eye(4)
135  workspace_rotation[:3, :3] = np.stack([ws_x_vec, ws_y_vec, ws_z_vec]).T
136 
137  workspace = Workspace(workspace_name, description)
138  workspace.points = points
139  workspace.robot_poses = robot_poses if robot_poses is not None else []
140  workspace.position_matrix = position_matrix
141  workspace.rotation_matrix = workspace_rotation
142  workspace.x_width = np.linalg.norm(ws_points[1] - ws_points[0])
143  workspace.y_width = np.linalg.norm(ws_points[3] - ws_points[0])
144  workspace.yaw_center = self.__compute_yaw_center(ws_points)
145 
146  self._write(workspace_name, workspace)
147 
148  @staticmethod
149  def __compute_yaw_center(ws_points):
150  x_mean = np.mean([point[0] for point in ws_points])
151  y_mean = np.mean([point[1] for point in ws_points])
152 
153  if 0.05 < x_mean > abs(y_mean): # Workspace in front robot
154  return 0
155  elif 0.05 < y_mean > abs(x_mean): # Workspace on the robot's left
156  return np.pi / 2
157  elif -0.05 > y_mean and abs(y_mean) > abs(x_mean): # Workspace on the robot's right
158  return -np.pi / 2
159 
160  return 0
